page.title: 19BURLEY IN WHARFEDALE
page.content: Burley-in-Wharfedale is a village six kilometres east of Otley. Until the railway was built it was a farming village, but now it is mainly a place for people to live who work in Bradford or Leeds. The old cottages which the farm workers used to live in have all been smartened up with white paint and new windows and doors, and a lot of new estates have been built all round the old centre of the village. People move into the new estates and then object to any more new houses being built. The prices in the Burley shops are much higher than in Otley supermarkets, so the people who go to live in Burley must be richer than Otley people. When the school has hometime there are lots of big cars outside the gates to collect the children. They must not like walking!
